Articles.Content:
This year, 2012, the Kennedy Space Centre is 50 years.

The Kerbal Space Centre, while still in it\'s infancy, because of the creative spaceship designers and the daring and bold(?) astronauts have done things during it\'s 1st year (forums are just over 1 year old now) that goes far beyond what the people at Kennedy Space Centre dreamed about 50 years ago.

In celebration of space exploration, crazy ideas and science, please post a picture, video or description of your grandest achievement so far, to celebrate astronauts, kerbalnauts, and everyone who has contributed to the fact that space, both digital and not, is fu*king awesome!

For science, moar thrusters, and the dreams of multiplayer.

*raise glass*

I will need to take and upload some pictures but I have spent years working with model rocketry and used to teach it to boy scouts back years ago. I have a multiple launch capable controller which can hook up to 10 rockets on different lines. The largest rocket I have is about 2 metres tall. I havent built larger because this one is grand fun and expensive enough as it is to fire off! Car restoration, and preserving of history!

Awesome man! if you have pictures of those rockets, i\'d love to see!

here\'s a celebratory video (not from KSP, but from the beginnings of actual spaceflight)

http://www.redorbit.com/news/video/space_2/1112648585/kennedy-space-center-50th-anniversary-video/

Here is an album of KSP photos that took me several missions to put together in the correct sequence.

https://www.facebook.com/media/set/?set=a.10151002863543830.451570.571363829&type=3

Here is an album of KSP photos that took me several missions to put together in the correct sequence.

https://www.facebook.com/media/set/?set=a.10151002863543830.451570.571363829&type=3

Awesome!

P.S. I\'ll dig around and find my good space station. I\'ll attach a screenshot to this post later. I losted it
